content: the beanie the beanie is worked from the ribbing upward and then in the round ribbing the ch1 at the start of the row doesn t count as a stitch chain 7 row 1 single_crochet in the 2nd chain from hook and continue to the end of the chain 6sc ch1 and turn row 2 single_crochet in the blo all the way across 6sc ch1 and turn row 3 to 56 repeat row 2 at this point make sure your ribbing at the finished length will go round your head next slip_stitch the 2 short ends together closing the circle and forming your brim do not fasten_off body of beanie row 1 now turn your work 90° so you are working along the long side of the ribbing chain 1 the ch1 at the start of this row doesn t count as a stitch and single_crochet evenly across you should now have 56 single_crochet or the number of row you required to make the ribbing remember that is has to be a multiple of 3 plus 2 slip_stitch into the first single_crochet do not fasten_off we will be carrying the yarn with us as we work see the helpful diagrams below by one of my testers hilde ©tinyanaesthetist 2018 zahra fazel all rights reserved please do not distribute or modify the pattern however you are free to make as many hats as you please from the pattern provided you credit me i would love to see your beanie so please tag me #akilspompombeanie row 2 chain 3 this chain 3 doesn t count either double_crochet in every stitch across and slip_stitch into the first double_crochet 56dc up to this point i have used the same color change to accent color for row 3 so you will be joining your new yarn to where you have joined row 2 with a slip_stitch row 3 start of block stitch pattern you may refer to the notes above chain 1 single_crochet in the space between the chain 3 from the row below and the next double_crochet then ch2 and skip 3 double_crochet then single_crochet in the space after the 3rd double_crochet and the 4th double_crochet continue along the row in the same fashion till you reach the end… when you do your last single_crochet you should have 2 double_crochet and the chain 3 remaining so here you chain 2 and slip_stitch to the first single_crochet of the round change to main color for row 4 again as before but this time you pick up the dropped yarn from the end of row 2 and drop the contrast color yarn row 4 you will pick up your dropped yarn and continue… chain 3 and then make 3 double_crochet in the next ch2 space and repeat along the row to the last chain 2 space in the last chain 2 space which is the one before the join you will make 2 double_crochet not 3 and you will slip_stitch to the
